_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Friday, February 20, 6:29am - Please expect delays and changing lift status throughout the day as our mountain operations team work through the significant snowfall from this weeks storm cycle. 

Skies are expected to be mostly sunny today with a high near 28 degrees. Southwest winds around 5 mph. Crews began work well before dawn on extensive mountain safety work. We are moving at the speed of safety as Patrol and Operations teams continue preparing terrain and lifts for opening.

Check the Operations Update for detailed updates and operations plans for the day.

With recent new snow and more on the way, please practice deep snow safety: Ride with a partner, avoid the base of trees, and if you are going to fall, attempt to do so feet first. Beware of obstacles and other hazards that may be hidden beneath the new snow.  

Visibility may be affected by storm conditions. Please remember to ski with caution and leave plenty of room for stopping, and allow more distance from other riders.  

  • Parking reservations are every weekend and holiday. Learn more about our Parking Program and Carpool Incentives.
  • For real time information at your fingertips, download the Ikon Pass App for updates on lift status, events, weather, and more.
_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
All lifts at Palisades will operate on a delayed, phased schedule as teams remain in full re-establish and recovery mode following this weeks storm cycle, which brought over 10 feet of new snow. 

Alpine will operate on a phased schedule as well, with openings dependent on access, avalanche mitigation, and terrain evaluation.

In an emergency, please contact: Palisades Dispatch 1 (530) 452-7145 | Alpine Dispatch 1 (530) 581-8222
